name: creakily
content:
creakily adverb
(MAKING SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that makes a long, low sound: The door opened creakily. A child was swinging creakily on a swing.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the background, someone is swinging creakily in a hammock.She grasped the dusty handle of the passenger-side door and drew it creakily open.The old man rose creakily to his feet.

creakily adverb
(OLD-FASHIONED)
in a way that is old-fashioned and not now effective: Their new website makes those of its rivals look creakily old-fashioned. The first episode creakily establishes the characters and their backgrounds.
More examplesFewer examplesThe ballet has dated creakily and suits neither of these dancers.The first episode of a new series starts creakily, but warms up.The budget is creakily managed.
